rComments: I was very excited to take this class, studied for exams, and yet the tests are very tricky. You are graded on more semantics and not necessarily your knowledge of the material. Amy is also not the friendliest or most helpful in office hours which was a big disappointment since she seems so friendly and caring in lecture. Still overall a good class

Professor Ralston is the best! She provides you with more than enough resources for you to succeed in the class. Uses a clicker to give points for attendance/participation but also provides webcasts of lectures. Ralston is enthusiastic and makes the material very approachable. Knowledge from this class is very relevant to MANY fields. Enjoyed a lot

Professor Ralston is one of the most enthusiastic professors I've had. She goes out of her way to interact with the class and make it entertaining in a way that is engaging and interesting. She truly cares for her students. Provides mock exams that are similar in the content that will be on the actual exam. Also extra credit opportunities.
Awesome teacher who wants you to do well. Study the lecture audio, mock exams, and go to office hours/section and you'll get the A

Amazing prof., probably one of the best ones I've had at UCSC. Development is a complex subject, but Amy makes it easy to understand and enjoyable. She is extremely engaging and wants students to do well. But be prepared to memorize a lot.

Great professor, probably the best Bio prof I've had at UCSC. Made Development an enjoyable and very interesting class. She's patient, has lots of office hours, and even a class Facebook page. Take a class with her if you get a chance.
